intro: Pycreus atribulbus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pycreus, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific alpine habitats. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are typically narrow and pointed. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it is adapted to cold and harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
